alert.note: Alert for Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 31 at 12:00AM EDT until August 31 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast North Carolina, including the following counties, Bladen, Pender and Robeson. Portions of northeast South Carolina, including the following county, Dillon. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1200 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lumberton, Burgaw, Elizabethtown, Rowan, Pembroke, Fairmont, Maxton, Bladenboro, Rowland, Boardman, Lisbon, Elkton, Emerson, Abbottsburg, Bladen Community College, Ruskin, Lagoon, Council, Carvers and Butters. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
